thread.title: NCCU Men's Basketball Selected to Top Conference Again

title: NCCU Men's Basketball Selected to Top Conference Again
text:
NCCU Men's Basketball Selected to Top Conference Again 
Posted 5:07 p.m. yesterday Your friends e-mail addresses (comma separated): * Subject: * You must enter the characters with black color that stand out from the other characters More on this More NCCU stories 
Norfolk, Va. — For the second year in a row, the North Carolina Central University men’s basketball team has been selected to win the Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference title in the preseason poll. NCCU fit the bill last season when the Eagles finished the regular season with a 16-0 record in conference play, and earned their second consecutive MEAC regular season title. 
NCCU received 14 of the 26 available first-place votes from the ballots of conference head men’s basketball coaches and sports information directors for a total of 316 points. Hampton was selected second in the poll with nine first place votes (297 points), followed by their arch-rival Norfolk State (283 points) who finished second in the regular season standings during the 2014-15 season. 
Along with the preseason poll, the conference office also released the Preseason All-MEAC Teams and redshirt senior guard Dante Holmes (Baltimore, Md.) was voted to the Second Team. 
Holmes was named to the All-MEAC Third Team last year as all five NCCU starters earned conference honors. During the previous season, Holmes started all 33 games and was on the floor for an average of 28.3 minutes per game. He put up career-high 10.4 points per game and led the team in steals at 1.3 per game. 
2015 MEAC Men’s Basketball Predicted Order of Finish (As voted on by the Conference’s Head Men’s Basketball Coaches and Sports Information Directors) 
North Carolina Central (14) 316 points Hampton (9) 297 points Maryland Eastern Shore 249 points Howard (1) 235 points North Carolina A&T State 163 points Morgan State 159 points S.C. State (1) 144 points Delaware State 138 points Coppin State (1) 113 points Savannah State 103 points Florida A&M 31 points 
2015-16 Men’s Basketball Preseason All-MEAC Teams (As voted on by the Conference’s Head Men’s Basketball Coaches and Sports Information Directors) 
Preseason Player of the Year: Jeff Short, Norfolk State University 
First Team 
James Daniel, Howard, G, 5-10, 165, Jr., Hampton, Va. 
Jeff Short, Norfolk State, G, 6-4, 205, r-Sr., Bronx, N.Y. 
Quinton Chievous, Hampton, G/F, 6-6, 215, r-Sr., Chicago, Ill. 
Bruce Beckford, N. C. A&T State, F, 6-7, 215, Sr., Silver Spring, Md. 
Dominique Elliott, Maryland E. Shore, C, 6-8, 245, Sr., Savannah, Ga. 
Second Team 
Brian Darden, Hampton, G, 6-2, 183, Sr., Hampton, Va. 
Dante Holmes, N.C. Central, G, 6-3, 190, r-Sr., Baltimore, Md. 
D’Shon Taylor, Norfolk State, G/F, 6-5, 205, Sr., Nassau, Bahamas 
Cedric Blossom, Morgan State, F, 6-6, 225, Sr., Columbia, Md. 
Darryl Palmer, S.C. State, C, 6-8, 210, Sr., Summerville, S.C. 
Third Team 
Ricky Johnson, Bethune-Cookman, G, 5-9, 160, r-Sr., Akron, Ohio 
Devin Martin, Maryland E. Shore, G, 6-4, 205, Jr., Baltimore, Md. 
Greg Mortimer, S.C. State, G/F, 6-3, 191, Jr., Savannah, Ga. 
Brian Pearson, Savannah State, F, 6-7, 230, Sr., Monroe, Ga. 
Jarvon Pressley, Hampton, C, 6-8, 250, Sr., Charlotte, N.C. Credits
